reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: have just returned from a birthday stay at four seasons.have had the pleasure of staying in some wonderful places around the world and this hotel ranks at the top! from the moment we arrived to the moment we left everything was first class.a beautiful room with a fantastic view. amazing service from every member of staff....a very tasty complimentary birthday cake delivered to our room..we were made to feel very very special indeed.the creme de la creme was my experience with my treatments in the spa...unbelievable and i go to alot of spas! amazing massage and facial...out of this world. A HUGE THANK YOU to everybody who looked after us while we were there,just wished it could have been longer...go on treat yourselves to a magical stay at the four seasons.. from suzanne and hani.
reviews.title: AN ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS STAY...A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE

reviews.text: From the moment we were picked up at the airport we knew this was going to be a great experience & we weren't disappointed. the staff were excellent, very professional but still very caring. Our rooms were magnificent, very very comfortable. Nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel I would recommend this hotel very highly. Every aspect of the hotel excelled! We would definitely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights at this hotel in a suite. It was a lovely room but not what I would have expected for the price. It was just a large room with a sitting area not a suite. The bathroom was another issue. I would expect that in a suite the bathroom would be large enough to separate the toilet with a door from the rest of the bathroom. We also felt that for the price we were paying Internet should have been included. It was an additional $35 per device per day for Internet usage. That was an additional $70 per day. Ridiculous! We ate at the restaurant one night and it was excellent. We also had a drink in the lobby bar while listening to the piano player and that was lovely, but very, very expensive! The location of the hotel is
reviews.title: Elegant Hotel

reviews.text: very good and we could walk to many places. Budapest is a beautiful, friendly city. Wonderful food, beautiful views of the river and fun
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: markets make it a great place to visit. While this hotel is beautiful, has excellent service and is in a good location it was not worth what we paid. I've stayed in many other Four Seasons and felt that their value for dollar was much greater.
reviews.title: Best Location In Budapest

reviews.text: I had last stayed at the Gresham Palace in 2009 and am pleased to say that the hotel is still as beautifully maintained and as faultlessly managed as it was three years ago. Even 5-star lux properties occasionally suffer neglect over time, so I was pleased to see the continued attention to detail that makes this Four Seasons an especially fine property.
reviews.title: A Return Visit: As Magical As Ever

reviews.text: I was indeed happy to visit again with the extremely gracious Richard Koos and to also build a new relationship with Shirley Catubao. I was traveling solo over my birthday, and they were especially kind to provide both a complimentary upgrade and a cake for the occasion. Their friendship certainly made me feel both welcomed and at home, and all my staff interactions were uniformly positive.
reviews.title: This Hotel is an Experience!
Top Notch
reviews.text: The winter season is an exceptional time to enjoy the hotel in my estimation, as the lighter occupancy and the typically discrete nature of the clientele lends a feel of leasing a private residence, and I appreciate the hushed and bespoke luxury on offer.

As others have indicated, the property is an architectural gem both in and out and it invites you to linger over a cocktail or simply amble around to appreciate the design, materials, and quality of the restoration, as I recall the state of the building before its current life as the Four Seasons.
reviews.title: The best in Budapest!

reviews.text: I also give quite high marks to both the spa and the Gresham Kavehaz restaurant, and even if one were staying in another Pest luxury property, I would highly recommend enjoying the restaurant, as I find it leagues ahead of other hotel restaurants and very much in the same price point. Even better, I encourage you to make the Four Seasons your outpost, as it is perfectly located for both business and leisure guests, and it offers a luxury experience that soars above the other 5-star properties in the area.
reviews.title: Stunning property and great service

reviews.text: On Saturday morning i called the hotel directly after booking on the internet, my plan was for them to pick me up and make the whole visit organized. When the train arrived at Budapest Keleti station the hotels driver was waiting on the platform, it was a quick drive to the hotel where i was met by the Reception staff on getting out of the car....The most well organized hotel arrival i have seen in years....The whole stay was faultless, hotel is spotlessly clean and all staff where very personable and professional. We had breakfast and lunch in the hotel restaurant, after having just spent the week in Italy i can say they have a real espresso machine in this restaurant and can make real coffee....Western European prices but the quality is here at this property...I would stay again without hesitation....
reviews.title: Outstanding & Impeccable Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel, location, staff. Everything you'd expect. 24 hr free business centre, lovely calm pool and spa area, nice gym with TVs on all the cardio machines.
reviews.title: Budapest in January

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended
reviews.title: Perhaps one of the best and best run properties in Europe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not only is this a spectacular landmark property located at the very heart of Budapest - at the end of the chain bridge - it is managed with such care, precision and concern you might think you are royalty while there. Our room was well priced (around $350) and wonderful. But the magic just starts there. Every time we left the front door to take a walk, a staff member or door attendant would say "one moment Mr. Seltzer" and hand us a bottle of water for our walk. How did they know our names at the door?
reviews.title: Memorable Experience!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted tickets to the Opera and asked the concierge. He not only arranged wonderful tickets, but also at the face price with a modest service charge somewhere around $20 if I recall. In any case, I left in the morning with the request and returned that afternoon with outstanding tickets.
reviews.title: Fantastic
Great Bathrooms, Great Everything
reviews.text: I echo the raves elsewhere on this page. This is one fantastic hotel -- competently staffed, stunningly decorated. Our bathroom was probably the best we've ever seen in a hotel.

We are 4 Seasons fans already (and have high expectations from this great hotel group), and we simply LOVED this hotel. It is the most beautiful building that I've ever stayed in (glorious Art Nouveau original tilework, wrought iron and art just abound) but it's the 4 Seasons Staff, you can't beat them! Firstly, even before we arrived, I had corresponded with the Concierge who were very well informed and efficient. We booked the private Mercedes to collect us at the airport, which is an excellent service.
reviews.title: A little gem

likes.liked: — Style, beauty and fabulous 4 Seasons service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone we met in the hotel was charming, helpful and enthusiastic: a real pleaure to experience. For example, my husband went running each morning and, on his way back ,he was waiting to cross the road to get to the hotel. The doorman spotted him, nipped inside and proferred a cool bottle of water as my husband jogged in. Wonderful!
reviews.title: This hotel is worth every penny!!

likes.disliked: — extra charge for the use of computer in business center

reviews.text: We had a large Gresham Room (and had asked not to be on the 5th floor thanks to other TA reviewers); it was spacious, with lofty ceilings, and still plenty of room for my young son's rollaway.
reviews.title: Best Four Seasons Property Yet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One evening, we ate at their main restaurant, Pava (modern Italian). We had the most sublime Goose liver starter (my husband said it would be worth flying back to Budapest just to eat this) and also a superb asparagus and truffle risotto (another signature dish). The waiting staff were pleasantly attentive and knowledgable and really helpful too, guiding us with Hungarian wine selections (I tried several, before selecting the one I preferred).
reviews.title: Unbeatable Location & Superb Staff!

likes.liked: — Ideal location and great staff who speaks perfect English
likes.disliked: — Pricey Danube view rooms and pricey Pava Restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Much delayed review!
reviews.title: Glorious!
One of the most beautiful hotels anywhere!
reviews.text: Divided our stay between Prague and Budapest.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love the Four Seasons and stay there whenever we can—as far as the hotel is concerned, the Gresham is breathtaking---superb, well deserving of all of the fabulous reviews. Truly luxurious, from the grand lobby to each and every floor.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are impeccable—spotless, very comfortable. They use some fragrant powder when they clean, making the halls and rooms smell wonderful every day.
reviews.title: Great hotel. Succeeds in getting the details right.

likes.disliked: — The price....always sticker shock, but worth the money

reviews.text: Location cannot be beat—directly facing the Chain Bridge and the Buda castle, walking distance to the Parliament and anywhere else. Walked nearly everywhere, down to the Vasarcsarnok, across the Danube to Buda castle and the Fisherman’s Bastion (granted, not all in the same day!).
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the holidays, my wife and I thought we owed ourselves a little rest and relaxation, and what a better way than a day at the spa. And more specifically the spa at the Four Seasons. At we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: A Great Day of Spa Indulgence

reviews.text: While we are not spa experts, we do have them occasionally both here in Budapest and while traveling abroad. The facilities themselves are excellent. A well-stocked locker room that was roomy and comfortable. A short walk upstairs (or elevator ride) took us to the floor with the pool, co-ed sauna and jacuzzi and separate steam rooms. All nice and in the comfort expected from a Four Seasons property.
reviews.title: Awesome !!

reviews.text: And then the massage. In a word - outstanding. In detail - we selected the couples chocolate indulgence, more for the experience than anything. The massage was excellent and while I thought the chocolate was a bit overwhelming my better half loved it. The massage service was thorough with warm blanket wraps, warm shower (to rinse the chocolate off). All-in-all, the massage service and facilities were very good and highly recommended.
reviews.title: Christmas Day Brunch - fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And one final topic. The service. Top notch. Outstanding. Personable. We felt very welcome as the masseuses checked our comfort occasionally as did he front desk and pool area staff. The service was not overwhelming in anyway, just professional and welcoming.
reviews.title: Wow What a Place

reviews.text: Well done Four Seasons Gresham Palace Spa Team. We'll be back!
reviews.title: http://c1.tacdn.com/img2/sprites/ratings-v3.png

reviews.text: We were a bit nervous that the 4 Seasons Staff would be a bit snooty when introduced to our lovely 9 month old daughter but we couldn't have been more wrong. We were asked her age when we checked in and a few moments later the receptionist formally introduced himself to her, welcomed her and gave her a gorgeous little wooden racing car. We were upgraded to a large room with an extra sleeping area with a cot for our daughter. The cot contained a basket of goodies and toiletries for babies! baby towels, baby lotion, nappy cream, bath oil, nappies and a little rubber duck for the bath..... not to mention the lovely l'occitane verbena adult toiletries in the bathroom. Room service was fab after our late night flight and we asked for a kettle (for bottles), a high chair and some spoons and bowls for baby food, all of which were delivered in minutes. The next day, at lunch, we asked for a banana for baby. It arrived, beautifully presented, mashed up in very cute baby crockery with spoon!
reviews.title: Budapest with Baby

likes.liked: — the feeling of total luxury, being looked after impecably.

reviews.title: Great Expereince at Gresham Palace
reviews.text: The food was wonderful, the staff attentive and friendly without being OTT, the spa was stunning and the architecture and view unsurpassed in eastern europe. It was an amazing stay - we really didn't want to leave. We are going to New York for a week at christmas and had just booked our hotel. I'm going to try to cancel and go to the 4 Seasons NYC instead!!

This is a wonderful hotel in a beautiful, historic building. Two great restaurants inside the hotel. Also a fantastic, scenic location right in front of the Chain Bridge. Would have rated it a 5, but room service quality was consistently mediocre, at best (e.g. didn't have things on the menu and replaced them in our order without asking us).
reviews.title: The Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed In

reviews.text: The Four Seasons Gresham Palace is truly a palace. From the grand foyer, to the luxurious rooms, to the personalized service, this hotel is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed at. I have stayed at the Gresham Palace three times over the past two years as I've traveled to Budapest on business a few times and I've never been disappointed. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable, the hallways grand and decorative, the spa offers incredible services and the restaurants in the hotel are both excellent. You also can't beat the location - directly across from the Chain Bridge with phenomal views of the Castle District and a short walk to many great restaurants. My now husband proposed along the Danube so Budapest will always have a very special place in my heart.
reviews.title: Faboulos 3-night stay

likes.liked: — The service and the beauty of the place

reviews.text: I was scheduled to come to Budapest because of my Company' business is expanding in the city... I have found that property to be perfect for both business and leisure...
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Service needs improvement

likes.liked: — Beautiful hotel, rooms, bathrooms, spa, common areas, great renovation,

reviews.text: I must tell you, both Budapest and the Fours Seasons in that city are hidden treasures!
reviews.title: Four Seasons Budapest - a hidden treasure!

reviews.text: If they call George V to be the number one hotel of the world, than they should check out this hotel, too!
reviews.title: Elegant and Extraordinary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is just amazing with a glass dome, a huge chrystal chandelier that looks like floating above the Front Desk, beautiful mosaic tiles under your feet, and unbelievable what ironwork, glasswork and tiles are throughout the whole building!
reviews.title: Fabulous stay at the Gresham

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The basic rooms are quite small, just as in Prague, if you can afford, try the Gresham rooms, one of the largest, or even better, the corner suites, called here Park Suites. I stayed in 312, what an amazing room with spectacular views over the Danube river, Chain bridge, Castle district! Simply amazing!
reviews.title: Just Sublime

reviews.text: Staff is very helpful, attentive, and discreet, not too pushy...
reviews.title: The Paris of Eastern Europe with a hotel to match
